meanings.definition: Confined to a specific area or region.
meanings.sent1: The storm damage was localized to just one neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The outbreak of the virus was localized to a small town.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were localized to the living room, making the rest of the house look plain.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was localized in her favorite spot by the window.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies was localized near the bakery, drawing in customers from afar.

meanings.sent1: The project's impact was localized to just a few departments.
meanings.sent2: His knowledge on the subject was localized and not comprehensive.
meanings.sent3: The cat's interest in the toy was localized, ignoring all other distractions.
meanings.sent4: Her influence was localized within her close circle of friends.
meanings.sent5: The music festival was localized to a single stage, creating an intimate atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To make local in character or restrict to a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to localize their products for the international market.
meanings.sent2: She localized her search for the missing keys to the living room.
meanings.sent3: The chef localized the special dish to only be available on weekends.
meanings.sent4: He localized his attention on the task at hand, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent5: The artist localized her inspiration to the beauty of nature, creating stunning landscapes.
